Although they had never met, the two writers felt they were of one mind, each (i) _________ anticipating the contents of the other’s letters; never had two intellectuals been more (ii) _________.
Blank (i)
Blank (ii)
(A) ominously
(D) providential
(B) anachronistically
(E) shrewd
(C) presciently
(F) simpatico
